#summary Human Spinal Thoracic Nerves
[Home] -> [BiologicalLifeResearch] -> [HumanNerves] -> [HumanNervesSpinalThoracic]
----

This page is intended to list all nerves of biological human, which connect mind to human limbs and visceral organs.
Related findings are structured by other research themes.

<wiki:toc max_depth="2" />

Coverage verified by:
  * http://medical-dictionary.thefreedictionary.com/nerve (name base)
  * http://www.oluwoleogunranti.com/course/course1/nerves (MA reference)

= THORACIC NERVES - MOTOR ROOTS =

   * *T1 nerve* (MA:[http://www.oluwoleogunranti.com/course/course1/nerves/ne26.htm T1 NERVE]); BRANCHES={Muscular branches - large (enters the brachial plexus) and a small branch (1st intercostal nerve)}
    * *first intercostal nerve*
    * <img src="http://classconnection.s3.amazonaws.com/568/flashcards/989568/png/serratus_superior_posterior1332103126591.png">
   * *upper thoracic nerves* (thoracic intercostal nerves)
    * *T2 nerve* (MA:[http://www.oluwoleogunranti.com/course/course1/nerves/ne27.htm T2 NERVE]); BRANCHES={Muscular branches - 2nd intercostal nerve}
    * *T3 nerve* (MA:[http://www.oluwoleogunranti.com/course/course1/nerves/ne28.htm T3 NERVE]); BRANCHES={Muscular branches - 3d intercostal nerve}
    * *T4 nerve* (MA:[http://www.oluwoleogunranti.com/course/course1/nerves/ne29.htm T4 NERVE]); BRANCHES={Muscular branches - 4th intercostal nerve}
    * *T5 nerve* (MA:[http://www.oluwoleogunranti.com/course/course1/nerves/ne30.htm T5 NERVE]); BRANCHES={Muscular branches - 5th intercostal nerve}
    * *T6 nerve* (MA:[http://www.oluwoleogunranti.com/course/course1/nerves/ne31.htm T6 NERVE]); BRANCHES={Muscular branches - 6th intercostal nerve}
    * <img src="http://www.rci.rutgers.edu/~uzwiak/AnatPhys/APFallLect10_files/image013.jpg">
   * *lower thoracic nerves* (thoracicoabdominal intercostal nerves)
    * *T7 nerve* (MA:[http://www.oluwoleogunranti.com/course/course1/nerves/ne32.htm T7 NERVE]); BRANCHES={Muscular branches - 7th intercostal nerve}; DISTRIBUTION={supply the external oblique and internal oblique muscles of abdomen and the transversus abdominis}
    * *T8 nerve* (MA:[http://www.oluwoleogunranti.com/course/course1/nerves/ne33.htm T8 NERVE]); BRANCHES={Muscular branches - 8th intercostal nerve}; DISTRIBUTION={supply the external oblique and internal oblique muscles of abdomen and the transversus abdominis}
    * *T9 nerve* (MA:[http://www.oluwoleogunranti.com/course/course1/nerves/ne34.htm T9 NERVE]); BRANCHES={Muscular branches - 9th intercostal nerve}; DISTRIBUTION={supplies muscles of the anterior abdominal wall - rectus abdominis, internal oblique muscle of abdomen and the transversus abdominis}
    * *T10 nerve* (MA:[http://www.oluwoleogunranti.com/course/course1/nerves/ne35.htm T10 NERVE]); BRANCHES={Muscular branches - 10th intercostal nerve}; DISTRIBUTION={supplies muscles of the anterior abdominal wall - rectus abdominis, internal oblique muscle of abdomen and the transversus abdominis}
    * *T11 nerve* (MA:[http://www.oluwoleogunranti.com/course/course1/nerves/ne36.htm T11 NERVE]); BRANCHES={Muscular branches - 11th intercostal nerve}; DISTRIBUTION={supplies muscles of the anterior abdominal wall - rectus abdominis, internal oblique muscle of abdomen and the transversus abdominis}
    * <img src="http://www.cixip.com/Public/kindeditor/attached/image/20121122/20121122104412_41232.jpg">
   * *T12 nerve* (MA:[http://www.oluwoleogunranti.com/course/course1/nerves/ne37.htm 12TH THORACIC NERVE]); BRANCHES={Muscular branches - subcostal nerve}
    * *Subcostal nerve* (MA:[http://www.oluwoleogunranti.com/course/course1/nerves/ne219.htm SUBCOSTAL NERVE]); BRANCHES={Muscular branches, collateral branch, lateral cutaneous branch}; DISTRIBUTION={supplies the internal oblique muscle and the transversus abdominis; communicates with the iliohypogastric nerve and then gives a branch to the pyramidalis}
    * <img src="http://www.cixip.com/Public/kindeditor/attached/image/20121122/20121122135445_48690.jpg">

= THORACIC NERVES - SENSORY ROOTS =

  * *intercostal nerves* (MA:[http://www.oluwoleogunranti.com/course/course1/nerves/intercostal.htm INTERCOSTAL NERVES]); ORIGIN={arise from anterior divisions (rami anteriores; ventral divisions) of the thoracic spinal nerves from T1 to T11}; BRANCHES={lateral cutaneous, anterior, posterior}
   * *intercostal nerves, lateral cutaneus branch* (MA:[http://www.oluwoleogunranti.com/course/course1/nerves/intercostobrachial.htm INTERCOSTOBRACHIAL NERVE]); DISTRIBUTION={two nerves arising from the intercostal nerves and supplying the skin of the upper limb}
    * *first intercostobrachial nerve*; ORIGIN={second intercostal nerve}; DISTRIBUTION={skin on back and medial aspect of arm}; MODALITY={general sensory}
    * *second intercostobrachial nerve*; ORIGIN={third intercostal nerve}; DISTRIBUTION={skin of axilla and medial aspect of arm}; MODALITY={general sensory}
   * *anterior branches*; DISTRIBUTION={run forward to the side and the forepart of the chest, supplying the skin and the mamma; those of the fifth and sixth nerves supply the upper digitations of the Obliquus externus abdominis}
   * *posterior branches*; DISTRIBUTION={run backward, and supply the skin over the scapula and Latissimus dorsi.run forward the side two way side of the muscular supply}
   * <img src="https://www.scienceofmassage.com/dnn/som/journal/1307/FIG.%203%20INTERCOST.jpg">
  * *subcostal nerve, sensory* (MA:[http://www.oluwoleogunranti.com/course/course1/nerves/ne219.htm SUBCOSTAL NERVE]); ORIGIN={anterior branch of twelfth thoracic nerve}; DISTRIBUTION={skin of lower abdomen and lateral side of gluteal region, parts of abdominal transverse, oblique, and rectus muscles, and usually the pyramidal muscle, and adjacent peritoneum}; MODALITY={general sensory}

= THORACIC NERVES - SYMPATHETIC =

  * *celiac ganglion* (MA:[http://www.oluwoleogunranti.com/course/course1/nerves/ne336.htm CELIAC GANGLION])
   * *greater thoracic splanchnic nerve* (MA:[http://www.oluwoleogunranti.com/course/course1/nerves/ne291.htm GREATER SPLANCHNIC NERVE]); ORIGIN={thoracic sympathetic trunk and fifth through tenth thoracic GANGLIA}; DISTRIBUTION={descending through the diaphragm or its aortic openings, ends in celiac ganglia and plexuses, with a splanchnic ganglion commonly occurring near the diaphragm}; MODALITY={preganglionic sympathetic and visceral afferent}
   * <img src="http://www.netteranatomy.com/common/showimage.cfm?bFlag=0&type=f&imgFile=325-X3385.jpg">
  * *superior mesenteric ganglion* (MA:[http://www.oluwoleogunranti.com/course/course1/nerves/ne319.htm SUPERIOR MESENTERIC GANGLION])
   * *lesser splanchnic nerve* (MA:[http://www.oluwoleogunranti.com/course/course1/nerves/ne305.htm LESSER SPLANCHNIC NERVE]); ORIGIN={ninth and tenth thoracic GANGLIA of sympathetic trunk}; BRANCHES={renal branch}; DISTRIBUTION={pierces the diaphragm, joins the aorticorenal ganglion and celiac plexus, and communicates with the renal and superior mesenteric plexuses}; MODALITY={preganglionic sympathetic and visceral afferent}
   * <img src="http://classconnection.s3.amazonaws.com/376/flashcards/598376/jpg/splanchnic_31335351279037.jpg">
  * *aorticorenal ganglion* (MA:[http://www.oluwoleogunranti.com/course/course1/nerves/ne334.htm AORTICORENAL GANGLION])
   * *lowest splanchnic nerve* (MA:[http://www.oluwoleogunranti.com/course/course1/nerves/ne301.htm LEAST SPLANCHNIC NERVE]); ORIGIN={last GANGLION of sympathetic trunk or lesser splanchnic nerve}; DISTRIBUTION={aorticorenal ganglion and adjacent plexus}; MODALITY={sympathetic and visceral afferent}
   * <img src="http://web.uni-plovdiv.bg/stu1104541018/docs/res/anatomy_atlas_-_Patrick_W._Tank/4%20-%20The%20Thorax_files/C4FF46.jpg">
